byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM, SUSANNE CRAIG and THOMAS KAPLAN

abstract: United States Atty Preet Bharara's corruption inquiry is proceeding against New York State Senate Majority Leader Dean G Skelos and his son Adam Skelos; investigators have served several subpoenas and are scrutinizing Adam's business dealings, such as his hiring by AbTech Industries; prosecutors are looking into whether State Sen Skelos exerted any political influence in AbTech's winning of storm-treatment contract by his home base of Nassau County, LI.
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors have begun presenting evidence to a grand jury considering a case against Mr. Skelos, Republican of Long Island, and his son, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

headline.main: Dean Skelos, New York Senate Leader, and His Son Are Said to Be Focus of Corruption Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Is Said to Aim at Chief of State Senate

snippet: Federal prosecutors have begun presenting evidence to a grand jury considering a case against Mr. Skelos, Republican of Long Island, and his son, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
